node.title: Has COVID killed the popularity of indoor play centres?
node.alt: A playground with a red truck, blue and yellow slide and blue ball pit
node.description: Indoor play centres have long had a reputation for being "germ factories", but how risky are they now thatÂ we're living with COVID-19?
node.content:
["Love them or loathe them, indoor play centres are a largely unavoidable part of raising a young child \u2014 at least, that was until COVID-19 arrived.", "The centres\u00a0have long had a reputation for being \"germ factories\", and, in Canberra, they're the only business still not allowed to operate post-lockdown.", "The idea\u00a0of unvaccinated children\u00a0from different households and schools\u00a0mixing in a close-contact environment indoors has made ACT authorities wary.", "They are so concerned\u00a0that the\u00a0ACT government is paying indoor play centres to remain closed, while allowing other child-related spaces\u00a0like childcare centres to re-open.", "But some experts argue the centres\u00a0present \"low\" risks that parents and carers can weigh up before allowing their kids to leap back into the ball pit.", "
Play centres paid $20,000\u00a0 to remain shut
", "The co-owner of Canberra centre\u00a0Kidzplore,\u00a0Dennis Yu, said he understood the ACT government's position, as tough as it was for his business which has been shut for more than three months.", "While indoor play centres\u00a0in New South Wales and Victoria re-opened weeks ago, his centre\u00a0had been forced to keep its doors closed.", "\"We have a lot of people come in and say 'oh when are you open?' They call: 'when can we book our kids birthday party?',\" he said.", "", "
Dennis Yu is unable to open his play centre in Canberra to children yet.\u00a0(ABC News: David Sciasci)
", "The ACT government has paid indoor play centres a $20,000 grant each to remain shut for the month of November.", "In the meantime, Dennis Yu's business has submitted a COVID-safe plan to re-open on November 26, including a cap on numbers, more frequent cleaning and strongly encouraging masks for visitors\u00a0over 12 if they can't\u00a0practise physical distancing.", "But will parents return?", "Mr Yu thinks some will, others won't.", "\"A lot of parents, they have concerns about their kids' safety and health. Maybe some of them will wait and see how it goes and what happens,\" he said.", "\"But some parents, they can't wait to come back because their kids love it.\"", "
Questacon reopens to young, unvaccinated children
", "", "
Questacon director Graham Durant says the centre is happy to be welcoming\u00a0back kids.(ABC News: David Sciasci)
", "Perhaps the ultimate of indoor play experiences \u2014 Questacon \u2014\u00a0welcomed back visitors to its interactive exhibitions yesterday.", "The national science centre is usually swarming with children from all over the country,\u00a0but during Canberra's lockdown\u00a0it was forced online where it held about 500 virtual events.", "", "
Questacon had to close its doors and move its events online thanks to COVID-19.(ABC News)
", "The centre is only open on\u00a0Fridays, Saturdays and\u00a0Sundays to begin with, and will\u00a0increase its days and hours as demand picks up into the school holidays.", "Numbers at the centre will still be capped through ticketed sessions and staff will wear masks, but they will only be \"strongly encouraged\" for visitors \u2014\u00a0in line with ACT health guidelines.", "School groups are not expected to return until next year and parts of the centre will remain closed including the gallery with the popular \"free fall\" drop slide.", "Professor Durant said\u00a0the centre would\u00a0be as \"safe as it can be\",\u00a0acknowledging that\u00a0its focus on children made\u00a0it \"higher risk\" than an art gallery or museum.", "\"I think we've done what we can to mitigate that risk \u2026 it'll be hard to eliminate it totally, but I think people can have confidence when they come here that we're doing the very best for them and for our staff to make everybody safe,\" he said.", "
Indoor play centres closed to minimise COVID disruption to schools
", "", "
ACT Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith says the risk of transmission is particularly high in indoor play centres.(ABC News: Greg Nelson)
", "ACT Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith defended the government's decision to\u00a0keep\u00a0Canberra's indoor play centres closed for this long.", "She said the risk of transmission was\u00a0particularly high in those settings.", "\"It really was around ensuring that we could\u00a0maintain that protection for children under the age of 12 who are unvaccinated, in terms of the spread of the virus while we worked to re-open schools,\" she said.", "But senior paediatrician at the Royal Children's Hospital Melbourne, Jill Sewell, said that now those\u00a0precautions had been taken, the risk to children of indoor play centres was \"very low\".", "Associate Professor Sewell is a passionate advocate for play\u00a0and believes indoor play centres are \"very valuable\" for children.", "\"If the adults around them are vaccinated and if the usual COVID precautions are taken, such as ventilation, mask-wearing, appropriate distancing, then I think the risk to children is very low,\" she said.", "\"I think they can be compared to childcare centres, the indoor play areas of child care centres.\"", "Associate Professor Sewell acknowledged that\u00a0children were becoming a \"major reservoir\" for COVID infections, but said the health risks to them, in terms of severe illness or hospitalisation, were extremely low.", "\"Because if they've been closed for a long time and parents are worried about it, they need extra reassurance to say 'it's ok to bring your kids here' and I would say they are a safe place.\"", "
Parents must weigh up risks \u2014 including possibility of quarantine
", "Epidemiologist from the Australian National University Katrina Roper said there were known ways to mitigate the risks at indoor play centres \u2014 hand-hygiene, cohorting groups within the centre and minimising numbers.", "Although, she admitted the centres\u00a0would\u00a0be\u00a0\"an area where children spread the virus to each other\".", "But Dr Roper said perhaps the greater risk for children and their families would be being caught up in visiting an exposure site and thrown into quarantine.", "\"Are [parents]\u00a0willing to then take the risk that they may end up having to quarantine for 14 days?\" she asked.", "She said play centres were not high risk \"in terms of\u00a0expecting to see children\u00a0becoming\u00a0severely ill and hospitalised\", but said it was \"the impact on the parents and the family\" if a child became a case.", "With quarantine fatigue setting in, that may tip the scales."]
